properties.name: Stillwater Barbeque
properties.pro_tip: Snag one of their "Make BBQ Great Again" hats.

properties.name: Tyler's Barbeque
properties.method: Mesquite and oak blend; indirect-heat pit
properties.pro_tip: Go on Thursday for green-chile mac and cheese.

properties.name: Franklin Barbecue
properties.pro_tip: Beef ribs are Saturday only, making them the hardest to get in Texas barbecue.

properties.name: Freedman's
properties.pro_tip: Come early to nab one of the few parking spots in back. The spaces in front on the left are up for grabs too.

properties.name: La Barbecue
properties.pro_tip: Skip the line by ordering at least five days out on their website.

properties.name: Micklethwait Craft Meats
properties.pro_tip: The place is four tenths of a mile from Franklin Barbecue, and the wait is usually only 15 to 30 minutes.

properties.name: Stiles Switch
properties.pro_tip: On Southern Comfort Sundays, you can indulge in the likes of smoked chicken wings and "hog-rub fries."

properties.name: Terry Black's Barbecue
properties.pro_tip: One of the few Austin barbecue joints on this list that's open on Mondays.

properties.name: Valentine's Tex Mex BBQ
properties.pro_tip: You definitely want the smoked corn with Mexican crema.

properties.name: Miller's Smokehouse
properties.method: Post and live oak; indirect-heat pits
properties.pro_tip: Check the meat case for take-home options like Miller’s Grillers sausage packs.

properties.name: TRUTH Barbeque
properties.pro_tip: The "Love Texas" sign makes a perfect background for selfies.

properties.name: Vera's Backyard Bar-B-Que
properties.pro_tip: Get there early and ask to check out the pits where the barbacoa is cooked.

properties.name: Fargo's Pit BBQ
properties.method: Oak (and another unspecified wood); indirect-heat pit
properties.pro_tip: Go Wednesday for beef ribs.

properties.name: Payne's Bar-B-Q Shak
properties.pro_tip: Go on the early side. As the sign says, "We are open till we close."

properties.name: BBQ on the Brazos
properties.pro_tip: You can eat on a second-floor balcony that overlooks the racetrack of MotorSport Ranch, a sports car club.

properties.name: Cattleack Barbeque
properties.method: Post oak and hickory; indirect-heat pit and wood-fired rotisserie
properties.pro_tip: For the best twenty seconds of 'cue porn in Texas, go to Cattleack's website (sorry, it’s not on mobile).

properties.name: Lockhart Smokehouse
properties.pro_tip: After you eat, poke around the eclectic shops of the Bishop Arts District.

properties.name: Pecan Lodge
properties.method: Post oak and hickory; indirect-heat pit
properties.pro_tip: There’s no wait if you can find a seat at the bar.

properties.name: Top 5 BBQ
properties.method: Oak and pecan; convection-style gas rotisserie
properties.pro_tip: The tortilla chips for barbecue nachos are made in house and dusted with a spicy rub. You can get the chips to go too.

properties.name: 4-T's Bar-B-Q
properties.pro_tip: Don’t miss the gooey chocolate pecan pie from Thomas’s wife, Cyndi.

properties.name: Heim Barbecue
properties.pro_tip: The bacon burnt ends have healing powers.

properties.name: Baker Boys BBQ
properties.pro_tip: Add some fried catfish to your barbecue platter on Fridays.

properties.name: Rio Grande Grill BBQ & Tex Mex
properties.pro_tip: The smoked-chicken tortilla soup makes a great side.

properties.name: Blue Moon BBQ
properties.pro_tip: If you’re going for dinner on a Thursday, call ahead to reserve some prime rib.

properties.name: Heavy's Outdoor Bar-B-Que
properties.pro_tip: Chopped brisket, pinto beans, and barbecue sauce make a fantastic Frito pie.

properties.name: Gatlin's BBQ
properties.pro_tip: Avoid the lunch rush unless you love long, slow lines.

properties.name: Pinkerton's Barbecue
properties.method: Mesquite and post oak; offset smoker
properties.pro_tip: Stay late and enjoy a cocktail from the bar.

properties.name: The Pit Room
properties.pro_tip: Order the house-made chicharrones and drizzle them with hot sauce.

properties.name: Roegels Barbecue Co.
properties.pro_tip: Roegels loves to talk shop—chat him up and you will learn a lot about barbecue.

properties.name: Joseph's Riverport Bar-B-Cue
properties.pro_tip: Ask about the "Swamp Fries challenge."

properties.name: Snow's
properties.method: Post oak; both direct- and indirect-heat pits
properties.pro_tip: This is some of the least expensive top-quality brisket around—$15.95 a pound, in case you’re planning a party.

properties.name: Cooper's Old Time Pit Bar-B-Que
properties.pro_tip: The New Braunfels location may just be as good as the original—and it’s a lot spiffier.

properties.name: Kreuz Market
properties.pro_tip: BYOF. They serve on butcher paper and give you only a plastic knife.

properties.name: Bodacious Bar-B-Q
properties.method: Mesquite, post oak; four different pits: vertical flow, offset, indirect heat, direct heat
properties.pro_tip: The brisket is marathon-smoked for 24 to 26 hours. Get some.

properties.name: City Market
properties.pro_tip: There are two separate lines for meats and sides; bring a friend. Cash only.

properties.name: Smolik's Smokehouse

location.address: I-37 at exit for Texas Hwy 359

properties.method: Mesquite and hickory; wood-fired rotisserie smoker
properties.pro_tip: Go for the sausage (the family has been making it for a hundred years, so they know a thing or two).

properties.name: Hutchins BBQ
properties.method: Oak (brisket only) and pecan; indirect-heat pits
properties.pro_tip: “Texas twinkies”—brisket-stuffed jalapeños wrapped in bacon—are sold on weekends.

properties.name: The Smoking Oak
properties.pro_tip: The pitmaster’s mom makes the desserts, so get whatever is on display.

properties.name: Killen's Barbecue
properties.method: Post oak, hickory, and pecan; wood-fired rotisserie smoker
properties.pro_tip: Fried chicken on Sundays pleases non-beef eaters.

properties.name: Pody's BBQ
properties.method: Pecan, oak, and mesquite; offset smokers and a wood-fired rotisserie
properties.pro_tip: Pody will show you his sheriff’s badge if you ask nicely.

properties.name: 2M Smokehouse
properties.pro_tip: Go for the tortillas, which are so much better than white bread.

properties.name: The Granary 'Cue and Brew'
properties.pro_tip: Go on a Tuesday for killer pastrami beef ribs.

properties.name: Hays Co. Bar-B-Que
properties.pro_tip: Beans are in a serve-yourself pot across the room; do not miss them.

properties.name: CorkScrew BBQ
properties.pro_tip: You know you’re in Texas when you can add pico to any item for a dollar.

properties.name: Louie Mueller Barbecue
properties.pro_tip: Call in your order to skip the line.

properties.name: Tejas Chocolate Craftory
properties.pro_tip: The carrot soufflé will change your mind about what’s possible in a barbecue side.

properties.name: Stanley's Famous Pit Barbecue
properties.method: Pecan; gas-fired smoker (ribs), indirect-heat pit (everything else)
properties.pro_tip: Have a Breakfast Brother-in-Law in the morning and a Pork Brother-in-Law in the afternoon.

properties.name: Harris Bar-B-Que
properties.method: Hickory, oak, and whatever wood Harris can swap a chopped beef sandwich for; reverse-flow smoker
properties.pro_tip: Ask for Texas toast instead of a bun for your sandwich.

properties.name: Flores Barbecue
properties.method: Post oak; offset and reverse-flow smokers
properties.pro_tip: Order extra of the homemade pickles.

properties.name: Evie Mae's Pit Barbeque
properties.pro_tip: Grab a free Shiner from the beer tub while you stand in line.
